item.title: About me
item.description: Biography My name is Ruidong Li, a Bioinformatics Research Scientist at Gilead Sciences, Inc. in the Bay Area in California, USA. During my Ph.D. study in the Genetics, Genomics, and Bioinformatics (GGB) Program at Univeristy of California, Riverside (UCR), I developed two R/Bioconductor pacakges: GDCRNATools for integrative analysis of multi-omics data from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), and Hapi for whole-genome haplotype inference using single reproductive cell sequencing. I’m currently planning to make a comprehensive collection of standard bioinformatics pipelines (BioinfoHub) to facilitate the research for the community.
